Fantasy 











 





Detroit bullies
 




Billups and Detroit are already thinking 4-0 sweep.  (Getty Images)



      Nineteen-point deficit? No biggie. Tayshaun Prince and Chauncey Billups 
      combine for 44 points as Detroit takes a 3-0 series lead with an 81-74 
      win in Chicago. The Pistons are just 
      too good for the Bulls, Tony Mejia says.
    

  
 Related Links:• Series | East: Cavaliers 2, Nets 0 | Playoffs: Bracket | Leaders | Experts• West: Suns 1, Spurs 1 | Jazz 2, Warriors 0 | Mejia: Draft prospects | Yo!


 


 

 





 Elling: Sabbatini shakes things up at The Players


    

      
      His attitude turns off colleagues, but Rory Sabbatini is playing some 
      equally uppity golf. His 67 ties Phil Mickelson for the 
      first-round lead, with Tiger 8 back.
    

  
• Recap | Leaderboard | Sabbatini | Notes | Tee Times


 

 





 Start the bidding, because Dale Jr. is on the market


    

      In a 
      much-anticipated move, Dale Earnhardt Jr. will leave DEI -- the company 
      his father founded -- at the end of 2007. Pete Pistone says the 
      No. 3 Chevy is his future.
    

  
• Splitsville | Doyel | Freeman |  TEI? No kin do
